page.title: 06SHIPSTONE'S BREWERY
page.content:
In 1852,{James Shipstone}opened up his {brewery.}It is still here, in{ {Basford}today. Shipstone's may have chosen this part of Nottingham to start a brewery because the{ {underground caves}are at the right temperature for the fermentation of beer.
The{'drays'}(or waggons), which carried the barrels were pulled around the streets of Nottingham by{Shire {Horses}until the 1950's when lorries replaced them.
The children from Northgate Primary School interviewed{Mr. Spence and Mr. {Kirkland}who have worked for Shipstones for 40 years.
